title: Blue Screen of Death (BSOD)
description: Troubleshoot Windows blue screen errors and system crashes.

steps.title: Note the Error Code
steps.instruction: Write down the STOP code (e.g., 'CRITICAL_PROCESS_DIED', '0x0000007B') shown on blue screen. This helps identify the cause.

steps.title: Boot into Safe Mode
steps.instruction: Restart → Press F8 repeatedly → Select 'Safe Mode'. If Windows boots successfully in Safe Mode, the issue is likely a driver or software.

steps.title: Update or Rollback Drivers
steps.instruction: Device Manager → Look for recently updated drivers → Right-click → Properties → Driver tab → Roll Back Driver (if available) or Update Driver.

steps.title: Run System File Checker
steps.instruction: Open Command Prompt as administrator → Type 'sfc /scannow' → Press Enter. This scans and repairs corrupted system files.

steps.title: Check for Windows Updates
steps.instruction: Settings → Update & Security → Windows Update → Check for updates. Install all critical and recommended updates.
